response_parsed.title: Combining Secrets with Typing in Python 3.12+ Production Code
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates the integration of Python's built-in `secrets` module and type hinting (`typing`) for enhancing security while writing production code.
key_points: Use `typing.Final` to mark constant secrets as immutable
Incorporate type hints to help maintain code readability and ensure proper usage
Employ the `secrets` module for generating secure values at runtime
caveats: Never hardcode secrets in your code. Always use environment variables or other secure storage systems.
Ensure that the generated secrets are never exposed in logs or error messages.
Always test your code thoroughly to ensure secrets are handled securely.
